alert.note: Alert for Santa Fe (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 3:41PM MDT until September 30 at 8:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central New Mexico, including the following county, Santa Fe. * WHEN...Until 645 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 339 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.75 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen, with another 0.25 to 0.50 inches possible. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Cienega Creek, Into Arroyo Calabasas, Arroyo Calabasas, Arroyo Los Frijoles, Alamo Creek, Into Santa Fe River, Into Arroyo Ancho & Calabasa Creek, Santa Fe River, Rancho, Cañada del, Chamisos, Arroyo de los, Hondo, Arroyo, Acequia de Los Pinos, Ancha, Cañada, Into Arroyo Los Frijoles, Into Calabasa Creek and Arroyo Cuma. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Fe, La Cienega and Agua Fria. - This includes Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 272 and 280. This includes the following low water crossings... San Ysidro Crossing. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Arroyos, streams, and normally dry rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes. Water in arroyos can travel many miles and take hours to reach your location from upstream rain areas.
